newsitem.title: BOSNIA: Bosnian cardinal makes Easter call for tolerance.
newsitem.headline: Bosnian cardinal makes Easter call for tolerance.

text.p: Bosnia's Roman Catholic cardinal issued an emotional appeal for an end to religious intolerance and hatred in his Easter message on Sunday.

"We are tired of hatred. We are tired of injustice, provocations, destruction of churches and mosques, torching of religious symbols," Cardinal Vinko Puljic told worshippers at an Easter mass in the Sarajevo cathedral.
"We are fed up with this. Stop it. We want to live. Stop imposing hatred. We want a human being to be a human being," Puljic said in remarks broadcast on state television.
Puljic's appeal follows a spate of attacks over the past two months on religious buildings, including several Catholic churches across Bosnia's troubled Moslem-Croat federation.

A bomb exploded at the back door of a Catholic church in Sarajevo's city centre earlier this month. Last Friday, a mosque was hit by a rifle grenade near the western town of Livno in Croat-controlled territory.
Tensions have been running high between the federation partners since Croats opened fire on unarmed Moslems trying to visit a cemetery in Croat-controlled western Mostar last month.
Sarajevo police say they have taken elaborate security precautions for the scheduled visit to the capital by Pope John Paul II on April 12.
The Pontiff had to cancel a planned visit during the 1992-95 Bosnian war because Serb forces laying siege to the city declined to offer security pledges.
